situation.title: Visits to social facilities
situation.meta_description: Visits in any social service providers' facilities, retirement homes, homes with special arrangements, and any respite care social services in the residential form are prohibited.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Visiting clients of elderly homes and "special care" facilities (in Czech: "domov se zvláštním režimem", facilities which provide stationary care for persons with reduced self-sufficiency, e.g. due to drug addiction or a mental illness) as well as of a respite care facility of any type is allowed, visitors must, however, have fulfilled one of the following requirements beforehand:

  • to undergo an AOC SARS-CoV-2 antigen test directly on the spot, i.e. in the facility where the client they want to visit resides, provided a negative result, or
  • not earlier than 48 hours before the visit, to undergo a RT-PCR SARS-CoV-2 presence test and to prove its negative result, or
  • to prove that they survived the SARS-CoV-2 infection personally (max. 90 days before the visit). 

During the entire visit, it is necessary to follow any and all internal operational measures of the facility.

Visitors have to leave their personal protective equipment put on during the entire visit. Note that a face mask is NOT considered sufficient - in the context given, at least a FFP2/KN95 respirator without an exhalation valve counts as such.

Remember, when planning such a visit you are going to enter a facility with a higher amount of people being prone to worse progress of the COVID-19 disease.
 

Please behave considerately during your visit.
